headline: Bob Wade, Creator of Whimsical Art (the Bigger the Better), Dies at 76
abstract: Known as Daddy-O, he created roadside, streetside and top-of-the-roof attractions in Texas and elsewhere.
lead_paragraph: Bob Wade, a Texas artist whose 40-foot-long iguana sculpture once perched atop the Lone Star Cafe in Manhattan and whose 63-foot-high saxophone lured patrons to a blues nightclub in Houston, died on Dec. 24 at his home in Austin. He was 76.
